dialogs.line: Ah, a traveler! My companion, the other knight, spoke of you. I see you’ve chosen to journey without armor. They hold great respect for your resolve.
It is no easy path, yet it speaks of your faith in both your allies and your own swiftness.
Hmph. Faith and agility won’t stop an arrow from finding its mark. You’ll need wit and fortune to survive this forest.
Pay no heed to his warnings. Your choice is a noble one. Together, we shall face the perils ahead with unity and strength.

dialogs.question:
Before you proceed, one final offer...
Will you reconsider and take some armor for protection?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor. Some protection might be helpful, even if it reduces agility.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without. My allies are protection enough.

dialogs.line: A wise decision. At least now you’ll have some defense in the treacherous forest ahead.
If this is the course you deem best, I honor your judgment. However, remember that no armor can replace the bonds we share.
A fine choice! You place trust above steel, my companion will be proud. We stand as one.
Hmph. Very well. Just remember that fate offers no pity to the careless.
So, you chose to don the armor. My companion hoped you’d lean more upon us, but the choice is yours to make.
Bah! Trust may comfort the soul, but steel keeps you breathing. And judging by your wounds, you need a lot more of it!
Are you certain this is the protection you seek? Remember, weight can hinder as much as it guards.

dialogs.question: What will you do now? Keep what you have, add more, or set some aside in favor of trust?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take more armor despite the cost of agility.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed some armor. Trust in my allies is enough.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll keep what I have. A balanced choice feels right.

dialogs.line: Ah, an even wiser choice! Extra armor will serve you well.
If this is what your heart tells you, I shall not dissuade you. But remember... true strength lies in the spirit, not just the steel.
Ah, you’ve chosen to lighten your burden. My companion will be glad to hear it!
Together, we will face any challenge as steadfast comrades.
Hmph. So be it. Just don’t look to me when regret catches up.
Keeping what you have? A fair decision, I suppose.
Just be sure to remain watchful.
A measured choice. Stay vigilant, friend. With or without armor, we stand united.
